text: Rudolftelep is a village in Kazincbarcika District of Borsod-Abaúj-Zemplén County. Its population in 2024 was 676. == Location == It is located in the north-western part of the county, 10 km from Kazincbarcika. It is a hillside settlement, separated from Izsófalva by only one hill, from where the road 26 106, branching off from road 2609, leads to the village. == History == The village was once part of Izsófalva. In August 1993, the people of the village voted in a referendum to separate from Izsófalva. Because of administrative reasons, it only became an independent village in December 1994, and officially on January 1, 1995. == Population == In 2022, 88.1% of the population identified as Hungarian, 0.9% as German, 0.7% as Roma, 0.1% as Ukrainian, 0.1% as Bulgarian, and 0.4% as belonging to other non-domestic nationalities (11.9% did not declare; due to dual identities, the total may exceed 100%). In terms of religion, 9.9% were Roman Catholic, 7.1% Reformed, 5.6% Greek Catholic, 0.7% other Christian, 0.3% Lutheran, and 20.9% non- denominational (54.9% did not respond). == Notes == Category:Settlements in Borsod-Abaúj-Zemplén County Category:Villages in Hungary
title: Rudolftelep
